TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ComponentEditorPage extends System.Windows.Forms.Panel

Docs.summary: Provides a base implementation for a ComponentEditorPage.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ComponentEditorPage class is a complete implementation for a component editor page that consists of an empty window. You can extend this page to add your own controls. ComponentEditorPage is used by a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm> of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.WindowsFormsComponentEditor>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates an example ComponentEditorPage implementation.
[!code-cs[ComponentEditorExample#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.d_68_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ComponentEditorExample#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.d_68_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[ComponentEditorExample#6](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.d_68_1.cpp)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Deactivate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Deactivates and hides the page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void EnterLoadingMode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Increments the loading counter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each procedure that performs loading or initialization should first call the EnterLoadingMode method to indicate that it will load something before the editor can display the loaded editor page. When a loading procedure that called EnterLoadingMode completes, it should call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.ExitLoadingMode%2A> method to indicate that its part of the load process is completed.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is used as a counter to determine when loading is complete. A page is in loading mode if the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is non-zero.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void ExitLoadingMode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Decrements the loading counter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each procedure that performs loading or initialization should first call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.EnterLoadingMode%2A> method to indicate that it will load something before the editor can display the loaded editor page. When a loading procedure that called <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.EnterLoadingMode%2A> completes, it should call the ExitLoadingMode method to indicate that its part of the load process is completed.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is used as a counter to determine when loading is complete. A page is in loading mode if the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is non-zero.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsPageMessage(valuetype System.Windows.Forms.Message msg) cil managed

Docs.summary: Processes messages that could be handled by the page.
Docs.returns: if the page processed the message; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method gives the page a chance to process messages before the caller uses them. If this returns `true`, the message will be consumed; otherwise, the caller will continue to process the message.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void LoadComponent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Loads the component into the page user interface (UI).
Indicates how many load dependencies remain until loading has been completed.
Docs.value: The number of remaining load dependencies.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used to track the number of loading stages remaining. For each process needed to completely load the document, this counter is incremented before loading begins, and decremented when each loading process completes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a component must be loaded before editing can occur.
Docs.value: if a component must be loaded before editing can occur; otherwise, .

Gets or sets the page site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The site for this component editor page.

Docs.summary: Reloads the component for the page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called when the current component may have changed elsewhere and needs to be reloaded into the user interface (UI).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void SaveComponent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves the component from the page user interface (UI).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ShowHelp() cil managed

Docs.summary: Shows Help information if the page supports Help information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is only called if <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.SupportsHelp%2A> returns `true`. The Help system calls the ShowHelp method to provide Help for the page. ShowHelp is usually called in response to F1 or when the Help button is clicked to allow the page to bring up its associated Help topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool SupportsHelp() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the editor supports Help.
Docs.returns: if the editor supports Help; otherwise, . The default implementation returns .

Docs.summary: Gets the title of the page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The caller may use this to show the name of this editor before it's actually activated.
